• Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The k'uhul each sought the end of the other rival gods, by any means.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
As long as there are four or more card types among cards exiled with this creature, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
{W}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Those who refuse to swear allegiance to the k'uhuls must live in harsh lands as punishment.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap this creature.

cards.rules_text:
Creature spells you cast have affinity for artifacts. [i](Creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)[/i]
You can't cast noncreature, nonartifact spells.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I am now a part of something more.”
—Itotia[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This creature can't block.
You may cast this card from your graveyard by binding a creature you control in addition to this spell's other costs. [i](Turn it face down. It's an artifact with “{T}: Add {C}” and loses all other types and abilities.)[/i]

When this creature enters, for each player, bind up to one target permanent they control. [i](Turn it face down. It's an artifact with “{T}: Add {C}” and loses all other types and abilities.)[/i]
Whenever you tap a permanent for {C}, add an additional {C}.

At the beginning of each end step, draw a card if you activated two or more nonmana abilities this turn.
{1}{W}{U}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Training is tough! Taking a break is good for you, and for your dinosaurs!”
—Tati, dino trainer[/i]

cards.rules_text: You may choose a scalebond from among creatures you control. When you do, each of those creatures deal damage equal to their power to target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls. [i](A scalebond consists of a Human creature and a non-Human creature.)[/i]

[+1]: You may choose a scalebond from among creatures you control. If you do, until end of turn, whenever one of those creatures deals combat damage to a player, draw a card. [i](A scalebond consists of a Human creature and a non-Human creature.)[/i]
[-2]: Create a 3/3 green Dinosaur creature token.
[-6]: You get an emblem with “At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of target creature you control.”

cards.rules_text:
Haste
{3}{R}: Target creature can't block this turn. This ability costs {2} less to activate if this creature entered this turn.
Dash {1}{R} [i](You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)[/i]

Menace
Whenever Snaggle attacks, reveal the top card of your library and put it into your hand. You may pay life equal to that card's mana value. If you do, repeat this process. Otherwise, each opponent loses life equal to that card's mana value.
cards.flavor_text: [i]For six years in a row, Snaggle has swept the backsailing event.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When this creature enters, choose one—
• Return another target creature to its owner's hand.
• Exile target artifact or enchantment.
Evoke {G}{U} [i](You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters.)[/i]

Menace
Other creatures get -2/-2.
Evoke {1}{B}{B} [i](You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters.)[/i]

At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card, then mill two cards.
Tap seven untapped permanents you control, exile Midnight Communion: Exile any number of cards from your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library. Draw a card.
Tap three untapped permanents you control: Put your choice of counter on Noah Kingsley from among +1/+1, first strike, flying, vigilance, and lifelink. Activate only as a sorcery.

As an additional cost to cast Watch the End, tap four untapped permanents you control.
Destroy all creatures.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Noah Kingsley was six years old when the floodwaters came upon the earth.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Lifelink

When this creature enters, draw a card.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, choose another target creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player this turn, draw a card.

Trample, haste
If a creature you control attacking or dealing combat damage to a player or planeswalker would cause a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

Choose target creature you control, then choose one —
• That creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
• Destroy target noncreature, nonland permanent with mana value less than that creature's power.

Sacrament {B} [i](You may cast this spell for its sacrament cost if a creature died under your control this turn or by sacrificing one as an additional cost.)[/i]
Each opponent exiles the creature they control with the greatest mana value among creatures and they control.

Flying
Whenever this creature attacks, create a 1/1 white Vampire creature token with lifelink that's tapped and attacking.
Vengeance [i](When this creature dies with no decayed counters, return it to the battlefield with one. It can't block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.)[/i]

Lifelink
Whenever a non-Vampire creature you control enters, you may sacrifice it. If you do, create a 1/1 white Vampire creature token with lifelink, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Vampire you control.

Whenever a non-Skeleton creature you control dies, create a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, each opponent loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{WU}, {T}: Scry 1.
{2}{BR}, {T}: Flourishing Sporecap deals 2 damage to target player.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Its spores are brewed into teas of varying quality and lethality.[/i]

Flying
When Galewing Pterosaur enters, for each player, whisk away up to one other target creature that player controls. [i](Exile them. While each one is exiled, its owner may cast it for {2} rather than its mana cost.)[/i]

Whenever Gluttonous Hogtrap attacks, you may have it consume. If you do, draw a card, then you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped. [i](To consume, sacrifice another creature or exile a creature card from your graveyard.)[/i]
Counter target creature spell with mana value 3 or less.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The only comfort on Skira is the knowledge that nowhere is safe.[/i]
